title: BBC Local Live: Leicestershire on Friday 4 November 2016 - BBC News
summary: david stokes died from stab wound to chest .
post-mortems on sons adam and matthew not yet completed .
woman found guilty of steak-knife murder .
'neglect ' contributed to care home overdose death .
vardy and mahrez make shortlist for best fifa men 's player .
airport closing for 48 hours on saturday evenings .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from local live for this week .
updates will start again on monday at 08:00 .

documents.title: weather : chance of hail tomorrow
text: scattered showers for some this evening , especially in the west .
further east it 'll be mostly dry with clear spells .
overnight cloud will increase , with a few showers pushing through during the early hours and lows of 5c ( 41f ) .
a colder day tomorrow with a blustery northerly wind developing .
author: Kay Crewdson
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: latest headlines for leicestershire
text: latest headlines for leicestershire
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your comments : new abbey park footbridge
text: on facebook you 've been commenting on plans for a new footbridge connecting abbey park with belgrave road .
jerry wilson says : `` i 'm sure its a very nice bridge , but i cant help think that £ 1.3m could be better spent on more needy causes , like homes for the homeless , or health care issues . ''
mandy clarke says : `` not necessary at all waste of money ! ! ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: travel : glenhills way closed
text: looks like they 've closed the road now
glenhills way is closed just after the pork pie island in one direction and after soar valley way in the other
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : crash in leicester
text: i think they mean blocked
accident on glenhills way ( a563 ) only just passable from soar valley way end but the carriageway is clocked from the pork pie island end
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: care home apologises for 'unacceptable ' death
text: we 've now had a statement from the cedar court care home about the death of patricia rosen .
we are deeply sorry for the failings that led to this tragic and unacceptable death , and our thoughts and feelings remain with the family .
we have worked extremely hard to ensure that lessons have been learnt and this must never occur again .
this includes putting in place rigorous and robust protocols and ending our contract with the nursing agency in question . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police : stab victim could have survived
text: `` it has been incredibly difficult for james ' family to sit through the trial and hear how she lied , was deceitful and sat back and watched him die .
if she had up the phone to the ambulance service earlier and been truthful about his injuries he may have still been here today . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: murderer delayed getting her victim help
text: magson had denied murder , claiming mr knight was strangling her and her actions were in self-defence .
the prosecutor in court said magson had `` sacrificed '' her partner by waiting about 40 minutes to call an ambulance to tend to mr knight as he lay dying .
police say when she did call she did n't mention he 'd been stabbed - just that he 'd `` collapsed on her '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman found guilty of steak knife murder
text: a woman who stabbed her boyfriend to death with a steak knife has been found guilty of murder .
emma-jayne magson from sylvan street in leicester knifed james knight in the chest during an argument on 27 march .
the 23-year-old will be sentenced on monday .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakinghinckley deaths : children formally identified
text: the post-mortem examinations on the two children have yet to be completed .
however , the boys have now been formally identified as 11-year adam stokes and his brother five-year-old matthew .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingdavid stokes died from stab wound
text: a post-mortem examination has revealed david stokes died from a stab wound to the chest .
the 43-year old was found dead at a house in hinckley on wednesday along with his two sons .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : november in leicestershire
text: as it 's weather watchers birthday today , why not show you a few more ?
these were taken by suej in ab kettleby and scrappy in loughborough - keep up the good work .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: your photos : autumn trees
text: here are just two of the lovely autumn photos uploaded from leicestershire today .
the photo on the left was taken by catuk85 on a lunchtime stroll in castle donington .
the one on the right comes from scrappy in loughborough .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: surprising stories from leicestershire
text: i 've been out into our wonderful county in search of our past along with peter liddle - a retired county archaeologist .
we went to the far south east of leicestershire to a tiny place called bringhurst with an enormous history .
this is inside st nicholas church in the village
hear all about the history of it here ( about an hour and 10 minutes in ) .
author: Ben Jackson
BBC Radio Leicester presenter

documents.title: knives handed in across the city
text: police have tweeted an update on the amount of knives handed in at the six police stations in leicester during their knife amnesty
107 knives handed in during the first 2 weeks of our # livesnotknives amnesty .
why not hand yours in and make it 108 ?
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather watchers : one year on
text: here 's a selection of photos taken by weather watchers in leicestershire and rutland - on display in reception at bbc leicester
if you 'd like to become a weather watcher , you can sign up here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: community to raise money for memorial
text: a justgiving page has been set up to raise money for a memorial for adam and matthew stokes .
it 's been organised by parents who say their son was close friends with 11-year-old adam - they have set a target of £ 5,000 .
the two brothers and their father were found dead at their home in welwyn road , hinckley on wednesday .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: anti-islamic teacher banned indefinitely
text: a religious education teacher at a leicester school has been struck off for expressing anti-islamic views , attending far right marches and working as a security guard while off sick .
nicholas hall faced a professional conduct panel after a number of allegations were made against him while teaching at soar valley college .
he was also found guilty of allowing pupils to watch an 18 certificate film and accessing pornographic websites on a college laptop .
author: Neil Heath
BBC News Online

documents.title: watch : press conference verdict
text: here are my thought 's on today 's press conference and the fifa award nominations .
author: Ian Stringer
BBC Radio Leicester Foxes commentator

documents.title: happy birthday weather watchers
text: it 's a year since the bbc launched its weather watchers website .
if you have n't signed up to it already , register now , and start sharing your weather reports with others across the country .

documents.title: watch : nurse who gave the accidental overdose
text: mariana birsesteanu spoke to me about the night she gave patricia rosan the fatal overdose
author: Rob Sissons
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: foxes make award shortlist
text: jamie vardy and riyad mahrez have been named on the shortlist for the best fifa men 's player 2016 award .
i guess we can should mention that former fox n'golo kante is also on the list .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: family believes care home death was 'wholly avoidable '
text: `` while our mum was frail , her tragic death at cedar court that night was wholly avoidable .

we hope that the coroner 's conclusions will serve to remind all nursing staff of the need to adhere to medication protocols and that the safety of residents and the training of , and support for , staff in their homes should always be at the forefront of their minds . ''
author: Rob Sissons
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: patricia rosen had been 'looking forward ' to moving into cedar court
text: `` the family wish to thank the coroner for leading an extremely fair , empathetic , comprehensive and diligent inquest into the death of our mum .

our mum , a nurse herself for much of her life , had been in declining health for a number of years and had been in hospital for four months prior to going to cedar court but she was a strong-willed woman with a zest for life , who came through many problems and was very much looking forward to moving into the home . ''
author: Rob Sissons
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: latest leicestershire headlines
text: latest leicestershire headlines
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rowdiness and petty crime by street drinkers
text: police want a shop to be stopped from selling strong beer , lager and cider because of drink-fuelled anti-social behaviour around new walk .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: care home overdose : 'changes made '
text: patricia rosen died at the home on 18 february 2013 - at this time international nurses working in the uk were not made to carry out a language test .
this has since changed .
procedures at the care home have also changed to try to prevent this from happening again .
author: Rob Sissons
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: nurse 'struggled to understand care home drug system '
text: the coroner found there was no proper care plan in place for patricia rosen .
she 'd only been there a few hours when she was given the fatal medication .
the coroner said the unit was short staffed and that agency nurse marianna birasteanu , who administered the medication , had poor english and struggled to understand the drug system at cedar court .
author: Rob Sissons
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: breaking'neglect contributed to care home overdose death '
text: a coroner has concluded that neglect at cedar court care home in wigston contributed to the death of patricia rosen .
the 78-year-old was given 16 times her usual dose of the painkiller oxycodone , which was meant for another resident called patricia .
author: Rob Sissons
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: thousands expected at bonfire display
text: it 's that time of the year again yes bonfire night is upon us .
i 've been over to leicester racecourse , speaking to the event organiser for their display .
vicki blunt from the rainbows charity told me more than 10,000 people are expected to attend and she hopes to raise a staggering £ 40,000 .
with two magical firework displays and a huge bonfire , it 's sure to be a toasty night ahead .
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: listen : ranieri talks about schmeichel 's injury
text: we asked claudio if kasper said anything about his hand hurting at half time
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: led lighting to be installed on runway
text: the first of the 48-hour airport closures starts tomorrow at 20:00 - it 'll then reopen at the same time on monday .
this will continue until monday 19 december .
as well as being resurfaced , led lighting is also being added to the runway .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: airport closing runway for repairs
text: if you were looking to use east midlands airport over the next few weeks you might have noticed an unusual lack of flights on certain days - that 's because the airport is closing for resurfacing between saturday and monday evenings .
usually this is done in a full 14-day block but , for the first time ever in the uk , east midlands airport is doing it in seven 48-hour blocks .
over seven weeks , in other words .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ranieri thanks players for nomination
text: earlier this week we found out claudio ranieri was on the shortlist for fifa best men 's coach .
he told us : it 's amazing .
i can only say thank you to my players .
leicester made something special . ''
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: ranieri on schmeichel 's fractured hand
text: claudio ranieri has been speaking about kasper schmeichel at the leicester city press conference - he 's confirmed he 's out for four to six weeks with a fractured hand .
he said : last night he had an operation .
the surgeon said he 's ok .
the hands for the keepers as with the boxer is very important . ''
the boss said he has confidence in his replacement goalkeeper ron-robert zieler .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: a message from kasper
text: we found out yesterday that leicester city 's keeper had fractured his hand , and this morning he 's tweeted this message
my operation went well last night .
thank you for all the messages of support .
deeply frustrating but i 'll do all i can to be back asap
tnk god for succès in operation
worlds number 1 for me
hope you 're on the mend soon mate !
you will be missed .
p1
how was your beef stroganoff champ !
# champ # hospital # food
glad to hear you are doing ok. be good to see you back when you are ready
hope you 're feeling better
glad it went well well fella , get well soon !
your a legend
get well sonn kasper
get well soon .
we will miss you
@ twitterid hope you get better soon dude
pls , get very very fast ok !
one love
get well soon sir !
we 're not the same without you controlling the back
best of luck with your recovery .
ca n't wait for the danish fox to return !
the movie inferno is so so good
good luck , rest well and see you back in no time .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : a dull start in south wigston
text: not a very cheerful photo , but weather watching is n't all blue skies and sunshine !
thanks to xkizzi for uploading this photo of a lock in south wigston , where they had quite a dull and damp start .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: band excited about download 's 'energy and atmosphere '
text: system of a down previously headlined donwload in 2005 and 2011 .

the band said : `` it 'll have been a couple of years since our memorable wake up the souls show at wembley , so returning to the uk to headline download , a festival we always love to play , is really exciting for us .
the energy and atmosphere there is always electric . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: download announces 2017 headliners
text: haavy metal band system of a down will headline donington 's download festival for the third time next year
they 'll be joined at the top of the bill by aerosmith and biffy clyro .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wigston 's big worms
text: following the excellent news about dave the record breaking worm i was sent on a hunt to find `` worms and a worm expert ''
i arrived at wigston tackle fishing shop as it opened , and brian allen was only to happy to show off the size of his .
you can buy 50 of the 20cm-long variety for £ 16 , and apparently they fly off the shelves .
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: foxes hand out danish treats for the press
text: lovely comedy from lcfc - 36 hours after playing a champions league game in denmark , danish pastries have been put out
author: Ian Stringer
BBC Radio Leicester Foxes commentator

documents.title: foxes press conference ahead of west brom match
text: another quiet one at lcfc .
given it 's his fifth press conference in just over a week i 'm not surprised .
a few injuries and formation questions to get us going , i 'd imagine .
author: Ian Stringer
BBC Radio Leicester Foxes commentator

documents.title: a 56-mile walk to loughborough for charity
text: a father and son walked from stoke-on-trent to loughborough to raise funds to help a children 's orphanage in uganda .
author: Loughborough Echo

documents.title: fifa to announce best men 's player shortlist
text: the 23-man shortlist for the fifa best men 's player will be announced this afternoon - will vardy or mahrez feature ?
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: foxes international call-up
text: foxes daniel amartey and jeff schlupp have been called up by ghana for this month 's world cup qualifier against egypt in alexandria .
bartosz kaputska has also been named in the poland squad for their upcoming international matches against romania and slovenia .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: mayor claims new bridge could mean more 'major events '
text: abbey park is already the venue for hugely popular events such as bonfire night , and a bridge with the capacity to carry a larger number of people will not only be helpful to existing events , but could also increase the potential for abbey park to host further major events and attractions . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new plans for abbey park footbridge
text: the city council have revealed plans for this - a new , five-metre wide footbridge connecting abbey park to belgrave road .
last year , the idea was to build a three-metre wide one , but they 've since decided a wider bridge might be better .
they said it would be more suitable when there are large numbers of people crossing - for example on bonfire night .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: internationals in anglo welsh cup squad
text: leicester tigers pay bath tonight in their opening game in the anglo-welsh cup .
tomas leonardi starts at number eight and prop pat cilliers is among the replacements after recovering from a groin injury .
tom croft is also included in the 23 for the first time this season after having the start of his campaign delayed by a back injury .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: latest leicestershire headlines
text: latest leicestershire headlines
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'beautiful ' vigil for stokes family
text: father frank daly described the vigil and service as `` very beautiful indeed '' .
author: Amy Harris
Reporter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: foxes press conference
text: in sport news , claudio ranieri is due to speak to the media this morning - we 'll give yo updates on all the key quotes and headlines from 10:00 .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: tears for stokes family
text: some heartbreaking messages for adam and matthew at the vigil last night .
author: Helen Astle
BBC East Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: mercury front page
text: more from the stokes family vigil in the leicester mercury today .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: weather watchers : autumn sunrise
text: if you 've been admiring the beautiful photo at the top of today 's page i should probably tell you where it 's from
it was taken but one of our trusty bbc weather watchers known as andy 's rutland .
it shows the sunrise over empingham , with rutland water beyond .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man charged with bede park rape
text: in other news , police have charged a man with raping a woman in bede park in leicester at the weekend .
michal cezary podlaszczyk , of no fixed address , is accused of three counts of rape , one count of assault abh , sexual touching , assault by penetration , attempted theft , theft and robbery .
he 's due to appear at leicester magistrates ' court today .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: emmanuel ties ribbon in memory of classmate
text: five-year-old emmanuel went to school with matthew stokes - last night he tied a ribbon to remember him .
author: Helen Astle
BBC East Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: how the community is feeling
text: at the vigil last night , one person told me : `` i had to be here , it 's not personally affected me because i did n't know them but it 's really , really come close to home . ''
another said : `` we knew the family - beautiful children , just a normal lovely family , loving mum and dad . ''
author: Amy Harris
Reporter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: east midlands weather forecast
text: heads up !
could be some hail this afternoon
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: children leave messages for family
text: after the service , children in their school uniform hung ribbons and messages around the church garden .
one read : `` loved loads , sorely missed . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hundreds attend vigil for hinckley family
text: i 'll start off this morning with more on that tragic story about the deaths of a man and two children at a house in hinckley .
last night hundreds of people went to a vigil for david , adam and matthew stokes at st peter 's church in the town .
these are some of the candles that were lit for them .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : lights broken
text: # leicester traffic lights are not working at the narborough rd/braunstone ln junction .
engineer on the way .
care needed on all approaches .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: happy friday leicestershire - i hope you 're well this morning .
i 'll be writing the updates on your local live page today with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
it 's always nice to hear from you so if you 'd like to share a story or comment on one we 're talking about you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
